clinical_study.brief_title: Interrater Reliability of Subjective Pupillary Assessments

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, observational, non-randomized study of interrater reliability of pupillary assessments, comparing two clinical assessments to the Pupillometer.

primary_outcome.measure: 1. Explore the interrater reliability of pupillary assessments when conducted in the natural setting by a diverse group of practitioners

study_pop.textblock: Patients eligible for the study are those that have been diagnosed some form of brain trauma where brain swelling has been identified and pupil dilation has been incorporated into standard of care (e.g., TBI, stroke).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients are eligible for this study if they have been diagnosed with some form of brain trauma (e.g., stroke, traumatic brain injury, aneurysm)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prisoners
- Under 18 years of age

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center
